title: How Much Do You Know About Health-Care Costs?
text:
Almost any way you slice it, Americans spend more on health care than people in any other wealthy country. That’s true if you look at total spending, about $3.5 trillion in the U.S. in 2017. It’s true as a percentage of national income, at nearly 18% for the U.S. And it’s true on a per capita basis, given that the U.S. spent $10,739 for every man, woman and child in the country in 2017. That’s all according to the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

Yet the complexity of the U.S. health-care system means it’s hard to get a clear idea of who is paying, what things really cost, or why they cost as much as they do. How well do you know this complicated topic? Take our quiz to find out.
